intro: Tetrastigma yunnanense var. yunnanense, commonly known as the Yunnan grapevine, is a climbing vine native to southwestern China. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically followed by berries. It thrives in humid, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
